ds.util
Class DNode<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.DNode<T>

public class DNode<T>
extends java.lang.Object

DNode objects are the elements in a doubly linked list; they have three fields that designate the value and links to the successor node and to the predecessor node. The value field nodeValue has a specified type and the link fields next and prev identify the adjacent nodes in the sequence

A circular doubly linked list with a sentinel is the underlying storage structure for the LinkedList class. The sentinel is the DNode header. A sequential scan of the list in the forward direction begins at header.next (the first node) and moves up the list using the link field next until the scan reaches the header node. A sequential scan in the backward direction begins at header.prev (the last node) and moves down the list until the scan reaches the header node.

The variables are public since DNode objects are used only in implementation structures.

See Also:
DNodes

 DNode<T> next

Constructor Summary
DNode()
          Creates an instance with both the nodeValue and the next field having initial value null.
DNode(T item)
          Creates an instance with the specified item as the nodeValue but with the next and prev fields set to null.
